intro: Blepharipappus elegans, commonly known as the elegant blepharipappus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance. The leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, providing a striking contrast to the bright yellow blooms.
